metadata.title: CVE-2016-5835 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiverevision-history information by leveraging the ability to read a post,related to wp-admin/includes/ajax-actions.php and wp-admin/revision.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
